meanings.definition: Relating to the study of viruses.
meanings.sent1: The virological research team discovered a new virus in the lab.
meanings.sent2: Scientists use virological methods to understand how viruses spread.
meanings.sent3: The virological puzzle was so tricky that even the most experienced researchers were stumped.
meanings.sent4: Her mind worked in a virological way, breaking down complex problems into smaller, manageable parts.
meanings.sent5: The virological knowledge he possessed was like a powerful tool in unraveling the mysteries of infectious diseases.

meanings.definition: Involving the characteristics or behavior of viruses.
meanings.sent1: The virological symptoms of the illness were evident in the patient's blood test.
meanings.sent2: The virological changes in the virus made it more difficult to treat.
meanings.sent3: The virological dance between the immune system and the virus was like a battle of wits.
meanings.sent4: Her virological approach to problem-solving was both systematic and thorough.
meanings.sent5: The virological nature of the outbreak demanded swift action to prevent further spread.
